CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 8, 1960, pg. 17, reads: "Charming Buc Rooters - There wasn't any doubt about the sentiments of this lovely quarter before the opening pitch of the World Series on Wednesday.  The charming ladies are, left to right, Mrs. Mildred Baker, mother of Pittsburgh's Gene Baker, Gene's wife Ella; Mrs. Kay Jones, a friend of the family, and Mrs. Carrie Stevens, wife of first baseman R. C. Stevens. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mildred Baker, Ella Baker, Kay Jones, and Carrie Stevens in stands at opening baseball game of 1960 World Series, Forbes Field
